pli-tv-bi-vb-ss6:0.2: The nuns’ rules and their analysis
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss6:0.3: The chapter on offenses entailing suspension
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss6:0.4: 6. The second training rule on receiving food
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss6:1.1: At one time the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in the Jeta Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery.
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss6:1.2: At that time there was a beautiful nun called Sundarīnandā.
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss6:1.3: When people saw her in the dining hall, they were affected by lust, and they gave her the best food.
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss6:1.4: Being afraid of wrongdoing, Sundarīnandā did not receive it.
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss6:1.5: The nun next to her said,
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss6:1.10: “What can this man do to you, whether he has lust or not, when you’re without it?
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss6:1.11: Go on, Venerable, receive it with your own hands, and eat whatever fresh or cooked food he gives you.”
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss6:1.12: The nuns of few desires complained and criticized her,
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss6:1.14: ‘What can this man do to you, whether he has lust or not, when you’re without it?
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss6:1.15: Go on, Venerable, receive it with your own hands, and eat whatever fresh or cooked food he gives you’?” …
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss6:1.16: “Is it true, monks, that a nun said this?”
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss6:1.25: “And, monks, the nuns should recite this training rule like this:
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss6:1.26.1: ‘If a nun says, “Venerable, what can this man do to you, whether he has lust or not, if you’re without? Go on, Venerable, receive it with your own hands and then eat whatever fresh or cooked food he gives you,” then that nun too has committed an immediate offense entailing sending away and suspension.’”
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss6:2.1.4: … The nun who has been given the full ordination in unanimity by both Sanghas through a legal procedure consisting of one motion and three announcements that is irreversible and fit to stand—this sort of nun is meant in this case.
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss6:2.1.6: if she urges her on, saying, “Venerable, what can this man do to you, whether he has lust or not, if you’re without? Go on, Venerable, receive it with your own hands and then eat whatever fresh or cooked food he gives you,” then she commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss6:2.1.7: If, because of her statement, the other nun receives fresh or cooked food with the intention of eating it, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss6:2.1.8: For every mouthful, she commits a serious offense.
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss6:2.1.9: At the end of the meal, she commits an offense entailing suspension.
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss6:2.1.11: this is said with reference to the preceding offenses.
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss6:2.1.13: there is an offense as soon as the misconduct is committed, and no pressing is required.
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss6:2.1.15: she is sent away from the Sangha.
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss6:2.1.17: … Therefore, too, it is called an offense entailing suspension.
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss6:2.2.1: If she urges her on to receive water or a tooth cleaner, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss6:2.2.2: If, because of her statement, the other nun receives it with the intention of eating it, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss6:2.2.3: If, when only the male being has lust, she urges her on to eat fresh or cooked food received directly from a male spirit, a male ghost, a _paṇḍaka_, or a male animal in human form, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss6:2.2.4: If, because of her statement, the other nun receives it with the intention of eating it, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss6:2.2.5: For every mouthful, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss6:2.2.6: At the end of the meal, she commits a serious offense.
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss6:2.2.7: If she urges her on to receive water or a tooth cleaner, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss6:2.2.8: If, because of her statement, the other nun receives it with the intention of eating it, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss6:2.3.2: if she urges her on, knowing that he has no lust;
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss6:2.3.3: if she urges her on, thinking that she is not receiving because of anger;
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss6:2.3.4: if she urges her on, thinking that she is not receiving because of compassion for the family;
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss6:2.3.6: if she is the first offender.
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss6:2.3.7: The sixth offense entailing suspension is finished.
